head.title: National News Briefs; Affidavit Says Agency Favored Clinton Backers

hedline.hl1: National News Briefs; Affidavit Says Agency Favored Clinton Backers

abstract.p: Sonya Stewart, career civil servant at Commerce Department, files affidavit saying she has seen documents showing that seats on government-sponsored trade missions were awarded in part on basis of candidates' support for Pres Clinton and Democratic Party; affidavit is filed in lawsuit brought by Judicial Watch, a conservative organization (S)

block.p: A Commerce Department official has filed an affidavit in federal court here saying she has seen documents showing that seats on government-sponsored trade missions were awarded to companies in part on the basis of their support for President Clinton and the Democratic Party.

The affidavit was filed on Monday by Sonya Stewart, a career civil servant in a lawsuit that accuses Commerce officials of favoring political supporters in giving out seats on trade missions in 1994 and 1995.

The affidavit was filed on Monday by Sonya Stewart, a career civil servant in a lawsuit that accuses Commerce officials of favoring political supporters in giving out seats on trade missions in 1994 and 1995.
The suit was brought by Judicial Watch, a conservative organization. A White House spokesman, Joe Lockhart, denied the accusation.
